name: Redirect Network Login
author: Jeremy Pry

sections.description: Force all of the users on your Multisite Network to login at the main site address.
sections.installation:
Simple installation:

  1. Upload the redirect-network-login folder to your /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the “Plugins” menu in WordPress

Advanced installation (mu-plugins directory):

  1. Upload just the redirect-network-login.php file to your /wp-content/mu-plugins/ directory
  2. That’s it… the plugin is already activated! Take a look under Plugins > Must Use
sections.faq:
None yet. Ask away!

Installation Instructions

Simple installation:

  1. Upload the redirect-network-login folder to your /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the “Plugins” menu in WordPress

Advanced installation (mu-plugins directory):

  1. Upload just the redirect-network-login.php file to your /wp-content/mu-plugins/ directory
  2. That’s it… the plugin is already activated! Take a look under Plugins > Must Use
sections.changelog:
1.1.0

  • Use the get_network() function if possible (this was added in 4.6).
  • Update the Readme.

1.0.0

  • Plugin created

short_description: Redirect the the wp-login.php for sub-sites to the main site
description: Force all of the users on your Multisite Network to login at the main site address.
